org.fridlund.pacman.scenes

Class GameplayScene

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fridlund.javalabra.game.scenes.Scene
      • org.fridlund.pacman.scenes.GameplayScene

  • public class GameplayScene
extends org.fridlund.javalabra.game.scenes.Scene
    Contains the Pacman, GhostManager, SnackManager and a Camera for showing the world in the center. Also listens to a InputProfile, so no input is handled here.
     

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameplayScene(int id, HighScoreManager highScoreManager)

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cleanUp()
      OpenGL cleanup code.
      boolean isDebug() 
      boolean isPaused() 
      void pause() 
      void render()
      Applies the model view matrix to the camera, for updating all changes to the graphics card and after that renders all stuff in the following order:
      Level, Pacman, SnackManager, GhostManager.
      void rotateCameraLeft()
      3D effect of Camera turning 180 degrees to the left.
      void rotateCameraRight()
      3D effect of Camera turning 180 degrees to the right
      void setGameOver()
      Shows the game over menu, and your points won't get stored in the high scores file.
      void setGameWon()
      Basically the same menu as the game over, but now your points will get stored in the high scores file.
      void setGhostsInvincible()
      Makes all ghosts in GhostManager invincible again.
      void setGhostsReleaseable(boolean releaseable)
      Makes the GhostManager aware that the ghosts are allowed to leave the nest (for instance, when the super snack effect is over, all killed ghosts are allowed to return to the maze).
      void setup()
      Initializes all game play specific variables.
      void setWarningOfSuperSnackEffectSoonGone()
      Used from the SnackManager to inform the GhostManager to make the ghosts blink, because of super snack effect is soon over.
      void show() 
      void superSnackEaten()
      Makes all ghosts killable in the GhostManager for a certain amount of time (specified in the GhostManager) and also sets Pacman angry, to change his animation.
      void toggleDebug() 
      void update(float delta)
      Updates the initialized components.

      • cleanUp

        public void cleanUp()
        OpenGL cleanup code. If you load resources that Java garbage handler doesn't normally handle, then you'll have to release those resources manually.
        Specified by:
        cleanUp in class org.fridlund.javalabra.game.scenes.Scene

      • update

        public void update(float delta)
        Updates the initialized components. Only updates the camera if the game is over. This makes it possible to rotate the view even though the game is over.

        Updates the components in this order:
        Camera, Input, Pacman, SnackManager, GhostManager
        Overrides:
        update in class org.fridlund.javalabra.game.scenes.Scene
        Parameters:
        delta -

      • render

        public void render()
        Applies the model view matrix to the camera, for updating all changes to the graphics card and after that renders all stuff in the following order:
        Level, Pacman, SnackManager, GhostManager.

        Also renders a couple of black stripes at the sides of the world, to hide Pacman when he teleports from one side to the other.
        Overrides:
        render in class org.fridlund.javalabra.game.scenes.Scene

      • superSnackEaten

        public void superSnackEaten()
        Makes all ghosts killable in the GhostManager for a certain amount of time (specified in the GhostManager) and also sets Pacman angry, to change his animation.

      • rotateCameraLeft

        public void rotateCameraLeft()
        3D effect of Camera turning 180 degrees to the left.

      • rotateCameraRight

        public void rotateCameraRight()
        3D effect of Camera turning 180 degrees to the right

      • pause

        public void pause()

      • toggleDebug

        public void toggleDebug()

      • setWarningOfSuperSnackEffectSoonGone

        public void setWarningOfSuperSnackEffectSoonGone()
        Used from the SnackManager to inform the GhostManager to make the ghosts blink, because of super snack effect is soon over.

      • setGhostsInvincible

        public void setGhostsInvincible()
        Makes all ghosts in GhostManager invincible again.

      • setGameOver

        public void setGameOver()
        Shows the game over menu, and your points won't get stored in the high scores file.

      • setGameWon

        public void setGameWon()
        Basically the same menu as the game over, but now your points will get stored in the high scores file.

      • setGhostsReleaseable

        public void setGhostsReleaseable(boolean releaseable)
        Makes the GhostManager aware that the ghosts are allowed to leave the nest (for instance, when the super snack effect is over, all killed ghosts are allowed to return to the maze).
        Parameters:
        releaseable -
